radiographic_examinations.findings: Soft-tissue density surrounding the celiac axis and the origin of the superior mesenteric artery; multiple paraaortic lymph nodes were larger and more numerous than previously.

radiographic_examinations.findings: A plate-like opacity, 1.9 by 0.7 cm, in the left lower lobe; suspected subsegmental atelectasis or scarring.

Left-sided pleural effusion, patchy opacities primarily in the left upper lobe.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Less prominent atelectasis at the left base than on previous images.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Progression, with bilateral, vaguely nodular, patchy opacities; no evidence of pulmonary embolus.
Small, left-sided pleural effusion and adjacent atelectasis; prominent nodular abnormalities in the liver.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening air-space abnormalities in the left upper lung.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Numerous foci of decreased enhancement within the liver and unchanged appearance of nodular air-space opacities.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased number of superimposed ground-glass opacities and new septal thickening due to pulmonary edema.
